most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus

common_issues.title: Pieces OS application crashes or login issues after update
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing crashes on startup or getting stuck on the login page after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.0. This seems to affect macOS and Windows users. Proposed solutions include checking for database corruption, attempting login from the Pieces toolbar, and contacting support for real-time debugging.

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation on Pieces App Crash

**Key Points:**

* **User:** moazzem-pixel reports the Pieces app crashing on their MacBook Air (2022) with macOS 12.3 after updating from version 10.9.5.
* **User:** Provides crash logs and error messages for analysis.
* **Support:** Suggests a similar existing issue and asks the user to confirm.
* **Support:** Offers a support call if the issue is not the same as the suggested one.


**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces app crashes upon launch.
* User unable to use the application.


**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support suggests a known similar issue for user to review.
* Support offers a support call for further troubleshooting if the issue is not the same as the suggested one.


**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unclear if the user confirmed the suggested similar issue or scheduled a support call.
* Issue resolution pending further communication.

## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Problem:** @antoine79 is experiencing a database bootup issue, preventing them from accessing Pieces.

**Key points:**

* @antoine79 is a new user and willing to delete the entire database.
* The issue seems related to the initial database bootup.
* Pieces support has identified the location of the database for Windows and macOS.

**Solutions proposed:**

* Pieces support proposes real-time debugging to fix the issue.
* @antoine79 offered to delete the database and start fresh.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is still being investigated by Pieces support.
* They are in contact with another user who potentially has the same issue.
* A potential fix is being considered.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation suggests the issue might be specific to new users.
* Pieces support is actively working on a solution.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** Users are unable to link their Google accounts after updating to Pieces OS version 11.3.0 on Windows 11. The login page at https://authentication.pieces.services/ gets stuck in an infinite loading state.

**Key Points:**

* The issue affects users on Windows 11 after updating to Pieces OS version 11.3.0.
* Users are unable to link their Google accounts through the login page.
* The login page gets stuck in an infinite loading state.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces support team suggests attempting to login from the Pieces toolbar using the "Connect Account" button.
* If the issue persists, users are advised to schedule a meeting with the support team.
* The support team is investigating the authentication pipeline for potential issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The root cause of the problem is still under investigation.
* The support team is recommending users to attempt login through the Pieces toolbar or schedule a meeting for further assistance.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be related to a new authentication flow that was released recently.
* Manually refreshing the login page can cause issues with the callback to the application.
* Users are advised to restart the authentication flow if they need to refresh the page.

**Overall, the issue is currently unresolved, but the Pieces support team is actively working on a solution.**

common_issues.title: Pieces OS fails to launch after update
common_issues.description: Users are reporting Pieces OS failing to launch after updating to version 11.3.0 on Windows. Issues include database corruption errors, invalid port errors, and authentication issues. Proposed solutions involve checking log files, real-time debugging with support, and potential database resets.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* @SherlockSol is experiencing an issue with Pieces Desktop not launching on their Windows PC.
* @nathan-courtney-pieces requests additional information such as log files, hardware details, and Windows Build Number to diagnose the problem.
* @SherlockSol provides the requested log files and Windows Build Number.
* @mack-at-pieces is unable to reproduce the issue and suggests a video call to troubleshoot live.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces Desktop not launching on @SherlockSol's Windows PC.
* Difficulty in reproducing the issue by the support team.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Gathering additional information including log files and system details.
* Scheduling a video call for live troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* A video call is scheduled with @SherlockSol for further troubleshooting.
* @uzaxirr reports experiencing the same issue and joins the video call.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue seems to be affecting multiple users.
* The support team is actively working on identifying the root cause and resolving the problem.

## Next steps:

* The video call with @SherlockSol and @uzaxirr will hopefully provide additional insights into the issue.
* The support team will continue to investigate the problem and provide updates as they become available.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS startup issues and errors
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS not starting due to antivirus software flagging it as malicious, database corruption, and dependency connection problems. Solutions include adding Pieces OS to antivirus allowlist, downloading from Microsoft Store, choosing a different antivirus, and reinstalling the application. Pieces team is actively investigating and working on solutions.

related_issues.title: Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus
related_issues.text:
Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS_11.2.2.0_x64

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/160ed12d-f0a1-46be-bf36-05502353405e)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation
**Key Points:**

* Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS being flagged as malicious by antivirus software, including Kaspersky, Nod32, Malwarebytes, and ESET.
* This issue prevents users from downloading, updating, and running Pieces OS.
* The issue appears to be caused by the app's access to the User/Documents directory and its novelty in the market.

**Problems Identified:**

* False positive antivirus detection of Pieces OS as malicious.
* Users unable to use Pieces OS due to antivirus blocking.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Adding Pieces OS to the antivirus allowlist.
* Downloading Pieces OS from the Microsoft Store, where it is validated as safe.
* Choosing a different antivirus software that doesn't flag Pieces OS as malicious.
* Allowing users to choose the location of the User/Documents directory.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is ongoing.
* Pieces team is actively working on preventing the app from being flagged as malicious.
* Users can use the workarounds mentioned above until a permanent solution is implemented.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be primarily affecting users with third-party antivirus software.
* The Microsoft Store version of Pieces OS is considered safe and doesn't seem to be affected by the issue.
* Users are encouraged to report the issue to their antivirus software provider to help improve detection accuracy.

## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Problem:** @antoine79 is experiencing a database bootup issue, preventing them from accessing Pieces.

**Key points:**

* @antoine79 is a new user and willing to delete the entire database.
* The issue seems related to the initial database bootup.
* Pieces support has identified the location of the database for Windows and macOS.

**Solutions proposed:**

* Pieces support proposes real-time debugging to fix the issue.
* @antoine79 offered to delete the database and start fresh.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is still being investigated by Pieces support.
* They are in contact with another user who potentially has the same issue.
* A potential fix is being considered.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation suggests the issue might be specific to new users.
* Pieces support is actively working on a solution.

recommendations: **Prioritize database issues:** Investigate and address the root cause of database corruption errors, as they are causing launch failures and login issues in Pieces OS 11.3.0.
**Review authentication flow:** Investigate the authentication pipeline, particularly the Google account linking process, to resolve the infinite loading issue on the authentication page.

**Improve antivirus compatibility:** Collaborate with antivirus vendors like Kaspersky, Nod32, Malwarebytes, and ESET to address false positive detections of Pieces OS and minimize disruptions for users.

**Enhance startup diagnostics:** Implement more robust error logging and diagnostics during startup to help identify the specific cause of issues like invalid port errors and dependency connection problems.

**Provide clear workarounds:** Publish clear and concise workarounds for known issues, such as adding Pieces OS to antivirus allow lists, using the Microsoft Store version, and resetting databases, to minimize user downtime.
**Consider database reset option:** Offer a safe and user-friendly option for resetting the Pieces OS database as a potential solution for users experiencing persistent database corruption issues.

**Gather detailed system information:** During support interactions, request detailed system information, including OS version, hardware specs, and antivirus software, to aid in issue diagnosis and reproduction.
